issues.description: The method singFarmSongVerse in the template repository is declared without the required parameter 'Animal animal', which contradicts the problem statement's UML diagram and the solution repository's implementation. This discrepancy would confuse students, as the template code does not match the expected signature, potentially leading them to implement an incorrect version or face compilation errors when trying to align with the intended design.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template repository's singFarmSongVerse method in Farm.java to include the parameter 'Animal animal' as declared in the problem statement and solution, ensuring the method signature matches: private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal).

issues.description: The template repository defines the class as 'AnimalFarm' instead of 'Farm', which conflicts with the class name specified in the problem statement's UML diagram and used in the solution repository. This inconsistency could confuse students about the correct class name to use, leading to errors when integrating with other code like Main.java.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in the template repository from 'AnimalFarm' to 'Farm' to align with the problem statement and solution repository, ensuring students start with the correct structure without needing to make foundational changes.

issues.description: The class representing the farm is named 'Farm' in the problem statement and solution repository, but it is named 'AnimalFarm' in the template repository. This discrepancy creates confusion for students, as they may not easily map the concept from the problem description to the template code, potentially leading to compilation errors when trying to use the class as described in the problem and Main.java.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in the template repository from 'AnimalFarm' to 'Farm' to ensure consistent naming across all artifacts, helping students accurately map the concept without additional cognitive burden.
